Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails - 2 Day Doi Luang

Hike to the Summit of the 3rd Highest Mountain in Thailand, Doi Luang Mountain in Chiang Dao. Sleep in a homestay under the star and visit a huge beautiful cave and go caving for 3 to 4 hours.

Quick Facts

Price: THB 5,200
Duration: 1 night 2 days
Meal(s): Meals
Difficulty: This hike is for experienced/fit levels only.
Seasonal: November - February and Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday

More Info

Pick Up & Drop Off

Pick up 6:00 to 6:30, arriving around 16.00 to 17.00

Included

Round transfer, guide, meals, water, park fees and accommodation

Not Included

Extra snacks or soft drinks.

What to Bring

Wear shoes with grip suitable for trekking and climbing and pack a warm layer, mornings can be chilly at the summit.

Please support our mission by booking your trek directly with us on this site or by calling us instead of through a tour agency.

Highlights

  • Explore a cave hidden in the jungle
  • Discover the beauty of Summit Doi Luang

Itinerary:

  • Day 1: Pick up 6:00 to 6:30
  • Drive to local market to pick up supplies for the hike. Then we will head to Doi Luang National Park the drive will take approximate 1 and a half hours we - Arrive at starting point for the hike to the Summit. The hike will take approximately 4 to 5 hours to reach the peak.
  • The trail to the peak is incredibly scenic with panoramic views. Once we summit you will experience the beauty of Chiang Dao an incredible 230-250 million year old limestone massif in the Daen Lao Range and rises abruptly and impressively from the plains below where Chiang Dao town is located. Chiang Dao translates to the City of Stars, a reference to the high peaks and elevations in the immediate area.
  • Begin your 4 hour descent back down the mountainside through the rainforest enjoying the views and nature. We will take the trail through Keawlom which is diverse in flower species until we reach the end point.
  • Drive to the Karen Homestay where you will spend the night
  • Day 2: Have breakfast and then drive to starting point to the cave
  • Hike 3 to 4 hours through the cave
  • Have lunch and head back to Chiang Mai arriving around 16.00 to 17.00

Notes:
